description: This is a CLI module for the Universal Project Initializer tool. It parses command-line arguments to create project configuration objects, invokes template creation, and outputs project initialization details and success or failure status. The script facilitates the setup of various project types by processing parameters, handling paths, and converting template info into JSON format.

methods.name: Dict[str,Any] parse_parameters(params_str: str)
methods.description: Parses a comma-separated string of key=value pairs into a dictionary with appropriate data types.

methods.name: ProjectConfig create_project_config(args)
methods.description: Creates a ProjectConfig object from parsed CLI arguments.

methods.name: str make_path_absolute(path: str, base_path: Path)
methods.description: Converts a relative path string into an absolute path string based on a provided base.

methods.name: dict template_init_info_to_dict(init_info: TemplateInitInfo, project_path: Path)
methods.description: Serializes a TemplateInitInfo object into a dictionary with absolute paths intended for JSON output.

methods.name: output_json(success: bool, message: str, template_info: TemplateInitInfo = None, project_path: Path = None)
methods.description: Formats and outputs the result as a JSON string, indicating success or failure and including project info.

methods.name: main()
methods.description: The main execution function, handling argument parsing, project initialization, and output.

ctags.name: output_json
ctags.pattern: /^def output_json(success: bool, message: str, template_info: TemplateInitInfo = None, project_pat/
ctags.signature: (success: bool, message: str, template_info: TemplateInitInfo = None, project_path: Path = None)
